text: Hello everybody! It's Helen here!
Today I will show you 3 different recipes
for a dish  that every kid loves.
It's pancake!!!
Pancake seems to be very easy to make,
but actually, it's doesn't.
To have a soft, spongy and delicious pancake
we need to pay special attention to making the batter.
I'm sure the recipes I share with you today are not only easy
but also really quick to make thanks to the help of Ajinomoto pancake mix powder.
We'll make Dragon Fruit Pancakes,
Boba & Brown Sugar Pancakes and Savoury Pancakes.
With Ajinomoto pancake mix powder,
we won't have to worry about preparing the exact measurement of the ingredients
such as how many grams of flour, how many grams of sugar or how much milk for the batter anymore.
Instead, we only need to take care of ingredients
for the topping or filling or the sauce.
I'm sure your kids will loveeeee these recipes!
Let's get started!
We will start with Dragon Fruit Pancakes.
You will need
1 Dragon Fruit.
Today I use the Dragon Fruit with red flesh inside so the cake will have an interesting color.
1 pack of Ajinomoto pancake mix powder (traditional flavour)
and 50gr sugar.
First, peel the Dragon Fruit then dice 1/4 and save for topping later
Finely chop the other 3/4 then transfer into a blender.
Blend well until pureed
Next, mix 1 pack of Ajinomoto pancake mix powder (traditional flavour) with 180ml of Dragon Fruit puree,
add 1 tbsp of lime juice
and stir well.
Next, heat the pan on the oven
then remove and place the pan on a wet towel to cool down.
Scoop the batter and pour it to the center of the pan.
Do pour from a fixed point which is 20cm above the pan
so we will have beautiful round-shaped pancake.
When the bubbles arise on the surface of the pancake,
flip the cake and leave it for about 1 minute then remove.
Strain the rest of the Dragon Fruit puree and
transfer the juice into a pan, add sugar,
bring to boil for 5 minutes until the juice thickens to Dragon Fruit syrup.
Place Dragon Fruit pancakes on the plate,
stack them on top of each other, add some diced Dragon Fruits,
and drizzle Dragon Fruit syrup on. Finish.
Ta-daaaa! Now we have one of the most exotic pancakes
in the world.
The next is Savoury Pancakes. We will need:
2 lap cheong (Chinese sausages), 1/2 an onion (diced)
2 tbsp dried shrimps and 1 pack of Ajinomoto Pancake mix powder.
Thinly cut 1 lap cheong on the diagonal,
and dice the other one.
Soak 2 tbsp dried shrimps in warm water for 15 minutes until soft
then finely chop.
Heat the pan with 2 tbsp of cooking oil, add the diced onion and stir well
until the onion turns slightly clear.
Add finely chopped dried shrimps and diced lap cheong,
season with a pinch of salt and stock powder.
Stir well for about 3 - 4 minutes the add finely chopped green onions and coriander.
Turn off the heat and let cool.
To make delicious pancakes from the batter,
we will mix 1 pack of Ajinomoto pancake mix powder (traditional flavour)
with 140ml of water
and 1 tbsp of lime juice for a nice taste.
Heat the pan
then remove and place it on a wet towel to cool down.
Scoop the batter and pour it on the pan.
When the bubbles arise on the surface of the pancake,
add some finely chopped green onion and coriander then flip the pancake and leave it for about 1 minute.
Wow! The pancake already smells so good and looks so soft and spongy!
To serve these pancakes, we will drizzle mayonnaise sauce on one side of a pancake
then add the savoury fillings
and place another pancake on top
Then add another layer of mayonnaise sauce on top
and arrange the lap cheong slices to shape a beautiful flower.
You can also add salted egg yolk if it's available.
Wow! What are we waiting for? Let's have a piece of these delicious pancakes!
So we all have a new recipe
for soft, spongy and tasty savoury pancakes!
Last but not least,
let's try making the Brown Sugar Pancakes with Tapioca Pearls!
We will need: 100gr white tapioca pearls,
100gr brown sugar, 75gr cream cheese
35gr sugar, 50ml fresh milk
100ml whipping cream and 1 pack of Ajinomoto Pancake Mix Powder.
For the batter, please do the same with
the Savoury Pancake recipe.
Next, boil the tapioca pearls for 15 minutes
then cover the lid, turn off the heat and leave for another 15 minutes.
Rinse well under cold water.
For the sauce, boil 100gr brown sugar in 50ml of water with a pinch of salt then turn off the heat.
Soak the pearls in the brown sugar syrup.
Leave the cream cheese to room temperature
then mix well with sugar, slowly add the milk and stir well.
Keep the whipping cream cold.
In a bowl, whip the whipping cream,
then fold the whipped cream into the cream chesse mixture
and gently mix well with a whisk.
Store in the refrigerator.
Place the pancakes on a plate, stack the cake on top of each other,
then top with cream cheese and brown sugar tapioca pearls.
Ta-da!!!!!! It looks so irresistibly delish!
Why don't you try making it right now? The cakes are really soft, moist and
the methods are ways too easy!
Don't forget to hit THUMBS UP and SHARE this video to your friends!

Goodbye and See you again!
 
Byeeee!
